controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the customer types you serve, including beneficial owners and any politically exposed persons among them?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess customer type risk (individual, company, trustee, partnership, association, cooperative, government body) and identify beneficial owners and PEPs.

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the sources of funds and wealth of your customers?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess and document customer sources of funds and wealth as part of your risk profile.

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the nature and purpose of the business relationship with customers?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you collect and assess information about the nature and purpose of customer business relationships.

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the control structure of non-individual customers (e.g., ownership, management hierarchy)?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess the control structure and governance arrangements of your non-individual customers.

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the types of designated services you provide?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess risk associated with each type of designated service your entity provides.

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the methods by which you deliver designated services (e.g., in-person, telephone, electronic)?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess risk based on service delivery methods (in-person, telephone, online, branch, agent, etc.).

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the foreign jurisdictions with which you deal?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you identify and assess risk associated with foreign jurisdictions where you conduct business or have customer relationships.

controls.label: Are you aware that certain customers are exempt from CDD requirements (pre-commencement customers and those receiving specific designated services)?

groups.title: ML/TF Risk Assessment Framework
groups.description: The primary purpose of your AML/CTF program Part A is to identify, manage and mitigate money laundering or terrorism financing (ML/TF) risk your reporting entity may reasonably face in providing designated services in Australia. These controls ensure your risk assessment considers the mandatory risk factors.

groups.title: Collection of Risk Factors
groups.description: When identifying ML/TF risk, you must consider and assess the following risk factors as part of your formal risk assessment process.

groups.title: Scope and Exclusions
groups.description: Confirm your understanding of customer types and services exempt from these requirements.
